questions.question: What is the name of our galaxy?
What is a supernova?
options: A massive explosion that occurs when a star dies
The process of a star being born
A collection of billions of stars, gas, and dust
questions.correct_answer: A massive explosion that occurs when a star dies

questions.question: What is the Big Bang Theory?
options: The theory that the Universe has always existed
The theory that the Universe started from a singularity and has been expanding ever since
The theory that the Universe is gradually shrinking
questions.correct_answer: The theory that the Universe started from a singularity and has been expanding ever since

questions.question: What is a black hole?
options: A region in space where gravity is so strong that nothing can escape, not even light
A region in space where there is no gravity
questions.correct_answer: A region in space where gravity is so strong that nothing can escape, not even light

questions.question: What is a nebula?
options: A dense region of gas and dust where stars are born
A galaxy far away from the Milky Way
questions.correct_answer: A dense region of gas and dust where stars are born

questions.question: What is a constellation?
options: A group of stars that form a recognizable pattern
A region in space with no stars
A galaxy other than the Milky Way
questions.correct_answer: A group of stars that form a recognizable pattern

questions.question: Which of the following is used to describe the 'age' of the universe?
What does the term 'cosmic microwave background radiation' refer to?
options: Radiation left over from the Big Bang
questions.correct_answer: Radiation left over from the Big Bang

questions.question: What is dark matter?
options: A type of matter that interacts with normal matter
A type of matter that absorbs all light
A type of matter that does not interact with light and is therefore invisible
A type of matter that is very dense and heavy
questions.correct_answer: A type of matter that does not interact with light and is therefore invisible
